episodeTitle: The Fish-Man Island Will Be Annihilated?! Sharley's Prophecy!
description: After Sanji receives a life-saving blood transfusion, the crew explores Fish-Man Island. Caribou escapes from his barrel prison when mermaids accidentally release him. The episode concludes with fortune teller Madam Shyarly having a terrifying vision that Luffy will destroy Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Splash and Splatter's First Appearance
events.description: Twin newkama pirates Splash and Splatter are revealed as the blood donors who saved Sanji's life. Their revelation causes Sanji to scream in horror and foam at the mouth, creating a comedic moment.
events.significance: These characters provide the rare S RH- blood type that saves Sanji from death by blood loss after his massive nosebleed incident.

quotes.text: We were happy to help! If you need more blood, we can give you more!
quotes.speaker: Splash
quotes.context: Offering more blood to Sanji, causing him distress

events.title: Arrival at Coral Hill Main Street
events.description: Camie, Luffy, and Usopp arrive at Coral Hill's main street, the bustling central district of Fish-Man Island. Camie shows them around the colorful underwater town.
events.significance: Introduces one of the main population centers of Fish-Man Island, showing the daily life of merfolk and fish-men.

events.title: Madam Shyarly's First Appearance
events.description: Madam Shyarly, the proprietor of the Mermaid Cafe and a renowned fortune teller, is introduced. She is revealed to be a shortfin mako shark mermaid with the ability to see the future, and notably, she is Arlong's half-sister.
events.significance: Introduces a key character whose prophecy will drive major plot developments. Her relationship to Arlong creates an interesting connection to the Straw Hats' past.

quotes.text: I don't do fortune telling anymore. The future is better left unknown.
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Explaining why she retired from fortune telling

events.title: Shyarly Revealed as Arlong's Sister
events.description: It is revealed that Madam Shyarly is the half-sister of Arlong, the fish-man pirate who once terrorized Nami's village. Unlike her brother, Shyarly shows no prejudice against humans.
events.significance: Creates a surprising connection between the current arc and the Arlong Park arc, while showing that not all fish-men share Arlong's hatred of humans.

events.title: Discovery of the Candy Factory
events.description: The group encounters the Candy Factory on Fish-Man Island, which produces candy for Big Mom. Pappag explains that the factory bears Big Mom's pirate flag.
events.significance: First visual introduction of Big Mom's protection arrangement with Fish-Man Island, foreshadowing future conflicts with the Yonko.

quotes.text: That's the Candy Factory. See the pirate flag? This island is now under Big Mom's protection.
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Explaining Big Mom's protection of Fish-Man Island

events.title: Big Mom's Protection Arrangement Explained
events.description: Pappag explains that after Whitebeard's death, Big Mom of the Four Emperors took over protection of Fish-Man Island. Unlike Whitebeard who protected the island out of goodwill, Big Mom demands a monthly tribute of candy in exchange for her protection.
events.significance: Establishes the new political situation of Fish-Man Island post-Marineford War and sets up future conflict with Big Mom. Shows the difference between Whitebeard's benevolent protection and Big Mom's transactional approach.

quotes.text: Whitebeard never asked for anything in return. But Big Mom looks at it from a business perspective. She wants a lot of candy every month.
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Contrasting Big Mom's protection with Whitebeard's

events.title: Arrival at Gyoverly Hills
events.description: The group arrives at Gyoverly Hills, the wealthy district of Fish-Man Island where Pappag's mansion is located. The area is named as a portmanteau of 'gyo' (fish) and Beverly Hills.
events.significance: Shows the economic disparity within Fish-Man Island society and establishes Pappag's wealth and status as a fashion designer.

events.title: Vander Decken's Threatening Marriage Proposals
events.description: During conversation, the group discusses Vander Decken IX, who has been sending threatening marriage proposals and weapons to the Mermaid Princess Shirahoshi for years. King Neptune has been unable to capture him.
events.significance: Provides exposition about a major antagonist and the plight of Princess Shirahoshi, setting up future plot developments in the arc.

events.title: Pappag's Mansion Revealed
events.description: Pappag shows off his luxurious mansion in Gyoverly Hills, which is shaped like a giant seashell and houses his Criminal brand fashion store on the first floor.
events.significance: Demonstrates Pappag's success as a fashion designer and provides a temporary home base for some of the Straw Hats during their Fish-Man Island visit.

quotes.text: Welcome to my humble abode! The first floor is my Criminal brand store!
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Showing off his mansion to the Straw Hats

events.title: Caribou Escapes from Barrel Prison
events.description: Ishilly and her mermaid friends discover the barrel that Franky trapped Caribou in and loosen the bolts out of curiosity. Caribou breaks free from his confinement, using his Logia-type Swamp-Swamp Fruit powers to emerge as a muddy substance and trap the mermaids.
events.significance: Releases a dangerous enemy who will threaten the mermaids and cause problems throughout the arc. Demonstrates Caribou's Logia Devil Fruit abilities for the first time in this location.

events.title: Shyarly Has a Disturbing Vision
events.description: Despite having retired from fortune telling, Madam Shyarly feels compelled to look into her crystal ball after sensing something ominous from Luffy. She has a vision that deeply disturbs her.
events.significance: Sets up the episode's climactic revelation and demonstrates that Shyarly's fortune-telling abilities activate involuntarily when major events loom.

quotes.text: I didn't mean to see it... but I felt something from that straw hat boy...
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Explaining why she looked into the future despite being retired

events.title: Shyarly's Prophecy: Luffy Will Destroy Fish-Man Island
events.description: Madam Shyarly runs into the streets of Coral Hill in a panic, declaring that the Straw Hat pirate Luffy must be banished from Fish-Man Island immediately. She reveals her terrifying vision: Fish-Man Island will be destroyed by Luffy's hand. Her prophecies have never been wrong, having accurately predicted the Great Pirate Era, Whitebeard's death, and other major events.
events.significance: One of the most important prophecies in One Piece, creating immediate tension and fear among Fish-Man Island's residents. This prophecy hangs over the entire arc and remains unresolved, potentially connecting to endgame events involving the destruction of the Red Line and the fishmen's migration to the surface world.

quotes.text: The future has shown me... Fish-Man Island will be destroyed by the man in the straw hat! We must send him away at once!
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Publicly declaring her prophecy in the streets

quotes.text: I hope... I pray that I'm wrong this time... but my predictions have never failed.
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Expressing her fear about the prophecy

quotes.text: The future has shown me... Fish-Man Island will be destroyed by the man in the straw hat!
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Declaring her prophecy in the streets of Coral Hill

quotes.text: Whitebeard never asked for anything in return. But Big Mom looks at it from a business perspective. She wants a lot of candy every month.
quotes.speaker: Pappag
quotes.context: Explaining the difference between Whitebeard's and Big Mom's protection

quotes.text: I don't do fortune telling anymore. The future is better left unknown.
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Explaining her retirement from fortune telling

themes.description: The episode explores the burden of knowing the future through Shyarly's character. Her accurate but uncontrollable visions cause fear and panic, raising questions about whether the future is predetermined or can be changed.
themes.symbolism: The crystal ball represents the double-edged sword of knowledge—knowing the future brings no comfort when you cannot prevent tragedy.
culturalReferences: Fortune telling and prophecy in Japanese culture

themes.description: The episode contrasts Whitebeard's benevolent protection of Fish-Man Island with Big Mom's transactional approach, exploring different philosophies of power and guardianship.
themes.symbolism: The candy factory with Big Mom's flag symbolizes how protection can become exploitation.

themes.description: Through Shyarly's character, the episode shows that individuals can transcend the prejudices of their family and community, as she does not share her brother Arlong's hatred of humans.
themes.symbolism: Shyarly encouraging children to see with their own eyes rather than accepting others' opinions represents the importance of independent thinking.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a retired fortune teller burdened by her gift of prophecy. Despite wanting to leave the future unknown, she cannot help but see visions of catastrophic events. Her character is defined by her accuracy, her reluctance, and her fear of what she has seen.
keyActions: Introduces herself as the Mermaid Cafe proprietor and retired fortune teller
Reveals she is Arlong's half-sister but does not share his prejudices
Feels compelled to look into the future after sensing something from Luffy
Runs into the streets to warn everyone about her prophecy of Fish-Man Island's destruction
quotes: I don't do fortune telling anymore. The future is better left unknown.
The future has shown me... Fish-Man Island will be destroyed by the man in the straw hat!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy explores Fish-Man Island with his characteristic enthusiasm and curiosity, unaware that he has become the subject of a catastrophic prophecy.
keyActions: Explores Coral Hill with Usopp and Camie
Learns about Big Mom's protection of Fish-Man Island
Visits Pappag's mansion in Gyoverly Hills
Becomes the unwitting subject of Shyarly's prophecy

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji recovers from his near-death blood loss experience but is horrified to learn his life was saved by newkama pirates.
keyActions: Receives blood transfusion from Splash and Splatter
Reacts with horror upon learning his donors were newkama

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the walking and exploration scenes in Coral Hill and Gyoverly Hills for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 610 of the manga. Eiichiro Oda designed Shyarly's character to deliberately contrast with her brother Arlong's character design and personality.
Shyarly's voice actress Romi Park is famous for voicing Edward Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist and Temari in Naruto. Her casting adds gravitas to Shyarly's prophecy scenes.
The episode aired on December 25, 2011 in Japan, making it a Christmas Day episode. It achieved a 10.5% TV rating and ranked 3rd in viewership that day.
Gyoverly Hills is a pun combining 'gyo' (魚, meaning fish in Japanese) and Beverly Hills, reflecting Oda's love of wordplay in location names.

Shyarly's prophecy about Luffy destroying Fish-Man Island remains one of the most enduring unresolved predictions in One Piece, with fans theorizing it may connect to the final war and the destruction of the Red Line.
